episodeTitleJapanese: 屋根の上の決闘！フランキーVSネロ
episodeTitleRomanized: Yane no Ue no Kettō! Furankī tai Nero
description: Franky battles Nero on the roof of the Puffing Tom, unveiling new defensive techniques and transformations. Meanwhile, Sogeking secretly speaks with Robin about the crew's rescue mission, and Sanji continues his fight with Wanze.

events.title: Hoshi Shield Debut
events.description: Franky debuts his Hoshi Shield (Star Shield) technique during his battle with Nero. Franky expands his left forearm into a circular, shield-like state to block Nero's attack.
events.significance: First appearance of Franky's defensive shield technique, showcasing his cyborg body's versatility in combat.

events.title: Master Nail Debut
events.description: Franky uses Master Nail for the first time, breathing in air and shooting out a barrage of nails at Nero. Nero uses Geppo to dodge the attack.
events.significance: First appearance of Franky's ranged projectile attack, demonstrating his offensive capabilities.

events.title: Nero Uses Geppo
events.description: Nero demonstrates his Rokushiki technique Geppo (Moonwalk), jumping through the air by kicking off the air itself to dodge Franky's Master Nail attack.
events.significance: Shows that Nero possesses some Rokushiki techniques despite being an incomplete CP9 agent, highlighting the threat level of CP9.

events.title: Franky's Weak Point Revealed
events.description: Nero discovers and exploits Franky's critical weakness: his back is not reinforced with metal plating, making it vulnerable to attacks. Franky responds by lying flat on his back so Nero cannot reach it.
events.significance: Important character detail about Franky's cyborg modifications and a strategic weakness that affects his fighting style.

quotes.text: That's right! My back is my only weak spot!
quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky acknowledges his vulnerability after Nero exploits it

events.title: Franky Invincible Debut
events.description: Franky unveils his defensive posture called 'Franky Invincible,' lying flat on his back to protect his vulnerable unarmored back from attacks.
events.significance: Franky's creative defensive solution to his main weakness, though it limits his mobility.

events.title: Franky Kentauros Transformation Debut
events.description: When pressed to fight seriously, Franky performs his Centaur transformation (Franky Kentauros), splitting his legs vertically and sliding his front set forward to create four legs, allowing him to grab and restrain opponents.
events.significance: Major reveal of Franky's body transformation ability, showcasing the full extent of his cyborg modifications and combat versatility.

events.title: Ouch Finger Debut
events.description: Franky debuts his Ouch Finger technique during the battle with Nero, another tool in his arsenal of cyborg attacks.
events.significance: Adds to the growing list of Franky's combat techniques revealed in this episode.

events.title: Sogeking Reveals Rescue Mission to Robin
events.description: Sogeking secretly hides in Robin's coat and talks with her, revealing that the Straw Hat Pirates know about her reasons for leaving. He tells her that Sanji and Franky are on the train helping, and Luffy and the others are following on the Rocketman.
events.significance: Critical moment where Robin learns that her crew understands her sacrifice and is coming to save her, reinforcing the bond between the Straw Hats.

quotes.text: The Straw Hat Pirates know about your reasons for leaving.
quotes.speaker: Sogeking
quotes.context: Sogeking reassures Robin that the crew understands her sacrifice

events.title: Iceburg Survival Revealed to Robin
events.description: Sogeking informs Robin that Iceburg is alive, countering what CP9 had told her earlier.
events.significance: Undermines CP9's manipulation of Robin and gives her hope that her sacrifice wasn't necessary.

events.title: Sanji vs Wanze Continues
events.description: Sanji's battle with Wanze continues in train car 4. Wanze attacks with his Menkui Knocker technique, sending massive ramen legs flying at Sanji.
events.significance: Continuation of Sanji's subplot on the Puffing Tom, showing the parallel battles happening across different train cars.

events.title: Sanji Uses Kitchen Knives
events.description: Sanji easily cuts through Wanze's Menkui Knocker attack using kitchen knives. He comments on how Wanze, despite being a cook, knows how to take care of his kitchen knives, but doesn't follow the same 'kitchen tools are not for killing' policy that Sanji does.
events.significance: Shows Sanji's adaptability in combat and his principles about cooking tools, while highlighting the contrast between him and Wanze.

quotes.text: You know how to take care of your kitchen knives, I'll give you that.
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji acknowledges Wanze's care for his tools while fighting

events.title: Rocketman Encounters Discarded Train Cars
events.description: The rescue team aboard the Rocketman encounters abandoned train cars from the Puffing Tom that were disconnected and left behind.
events.significance: Shows the consequences of the earlier battle and provides an obstacle for the pursuing rescue team.

events.title: Zoro Slices Through Train Cars
events.description: Zoro slices through the abandoned train cars to clear the path for the Rocketman, demonstrating his swordsmanship power to cut through large obstacles.
events.significance: Displays Zoro's strength and problem-solving abilities, while keeping the rescue mission on track.

events.title: Zoro Senses T-Bone's Presence
events.description: At the episode's conclusion, Zoro notices defeated Sea Kings ahead and senses a powerful presence approaching. He puts on his bandana, preparing for battle. T-Bone is shown making his way toward the Puffing Tom.
events.significance: Sets up the upcoming battle between Zoro and Ship-Slasher T-Bone in the next episode, building tension for the rescue arc.

themes.description: The episode emphasizes the Straw Hats' unwavering loyalty to Robin, despite her attempt to sacrifice herself for their safety. Sogeking's revelation to Robin shows that the crew understands and rejects her sacrifice.
themes.symbolism: Sogeking hiding in Robin's coat represents the crew's determination to be close to her even in her darkest moment.

themes.description: Franky demonstrates that true strength comes from understanding and adapting to one's weaknesses. Rather than hiding his vulnerable back, he develops fighting techniques that work around this limitation.
themes.symbolism: The Centaur transformation represents Franky's creative approach to problem-solving and combat.

themes.description: Multiple simultaneous battles (Franky vs Nero, Sanji vs Wanze, Zoro's preparation) showcase different fighting styles and the coordinated effort of the rescue mission.
themes.symbolism: The parallel conflicts on different parts of the train represent the distributed yet unified effort of the rescue team.

characterSpotlights.development: Franky reveals multiple new techniques and transformations, showcasing his cyborg abilities and fighting prowess. His vulnerability (unarmored back) humanizes him despite his mechanical enhancements.
keyActions: Uses Hoshi Shield to defend against Nero
quotes: That's right! My back is my only weak spot!

characterSpotlights.development: Sogeking takes a crucial role in the emotional core of the episode, reconnecting Robin with hope by revealing the crew's knowledge and determination to save her.

Informs Robin that Iceburg is alive
Tells Robin about the rescue mission
quotes: The Straw Hat Pirates know about your reasons for leaving.

characterSpotlights.role: Problem solver and next battle setup

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends several fight sequences, particularly Franky vs Nero and Sanji vs Wanze, with additional animated action sequences not depicted in as much detail in the manga.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first appearance of Franky's Centaur transformation, which becomes one of his signature combat forms.
The opening song 'Kokoro no Chizu' by BOYSTYLE was the first One Piece opening to be aired in widescreen format.

sources.title: Kokoro no Chizu - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Episode 260 covers parts of three manga chapters (370, 371, and 372), showing the anime's pacing during the Water 7 arc.
Franky's vulnerable back becomes a recurring element in his character design and fighting style throughout the series.
The ending theme 'Asu wa Kuru Kara' by Tohoshinki (TVXQ) features visuals of Nico Robin's backstory, connecting to the emotional arc of saving Robin.
